intro: Fumariola, commonly known as the "false poppy," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fumariaceae. These plants are characterized by their delicate, often showy flowers that resemble those of the poppy family. Fumariola species typically have slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and they produce small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, purple, or white. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral displays.
